definition[0]: to have complete control over something so that other people cannot share it or take part in it
example[0]: The company has monopolized the soft drinks market.
example[1]: He monopolized the conversation all evening.
definition[1]: to use a lot of someoneâ€™s time or attention
example[2]: Virtually all her time and energy is now monopolized by the children.
definition[2]: if a single company or a government monopolizes an industry, it gets control of all or most of it so that there is little or no competition from other companies or countries
example[3]: The company sold below cost in order to drive out competition and monopolize the Los Angeles-area market.
